page.title: 16TRELLECH LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: THERE ARE THREE STONES IN A FIELD AT THE EDGE OF THE VILLAGE. THE THREE STONES ARE SITUATED BY THE ROAD TO LLANISHEN. THEY DATE BACK TO 2,500BC. IN WELSH, TRELLECH MEANS THREE STONES. (TRE MEANS 3,AND LLECH MEANS STONES) THE TUMP IS SITUATED BEHIND THE CHURCH. IN NORMAN TIMES THE TUMP USED TO HAVE A WOODEN MOTTE AND BAILEY CASTLE, BUT NOW IT IS A GRASS MOUND. THE VIRTUOUS WELL IS SITUATED ON THE ROAD TO TINTERN. IN THE MIDDLE AGES PEOPLE USED TO COME TO THE WELL TO DRINK THE HEALING 'WATERS' THE GOTHIC CHURCH IS IN THE MIDDLE OF THE VILLAGE. THIS CHURCH REPLACED THE EARLIER NORMAN CHURCH. OPPOSITE THE CHURCH IS THE CHURCH HALL, WHICH USED TO BE A TITHE BARN. THERE ARE OTHER PLACES OF INTEREST IN THE VILLAGE,WHICH USED TO BE A BIG TOWN IN THE THIRTEENTH CENTURY.
